Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2008 05:30PM bks wrote: I was just reading the "cautions" on the different drugs and it just lists let your doctor know if you have liver problems.  Well, I guess I do.  Anyway, thanks for your input.  I have been taking Ativan, too, but feel like I might need an extra boost.  I'll be discussing this with my doctor tomorrow.  Maybe the Ativan is just as good as an antidepressant.  If I didn't have those I would be totally bonkers.

Posts.Content: bks wrote: Has anyone taken an antidepressant while having liver mets?  I keep reading how you shouldn't take an antidepressant if you have liver problems.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Liver mets and antidepressants bks liz35

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2007 01:58PM bks wrote: I was diagnosed with liver mets in November.  I am ER+ PR+ HER2- and was on Arimidex since my surgery in April, which apparently was not working.  I have a 1 inch lesion on my liver and the onc wants to try to treat it with anti-hormones before he brings out more chemo so I had my second shot of faslodex Monday.  I have heard it takes at leaset 2 months to see if it works.  I go back January 21st and I guess we should know by then if it is bringing my markers down.  I am very high in estrogen so somehow that has to be stopped whether I take more chemo or not.  Did faslodex work for anyone?  This whole liver thing is so scary.
